content.description: Start on the massive, obvious jug. Climb the right side of the boulder. Tricky topout.
content.protection: Pads. The landing is not great.
content.location: This boulder is slightly south east of the intersection between the red and blue trail. It is very close to the intersection and can be seen from the red trail.

content.description: I'm guessing this has not been climbed... There is an obvious starting jug that is slightly awkward to set up on due to the landing. Find some way to link into the stand start.
Start sitting on jugs on the lower left side of the large slab face. Compress into the arete and top out over the left side of the arete.
content.location: In the broken cliff band that can be seen from the green trail. Faces the trail.

content.description: Start standing on good holds. Climb on large edges to an easy topout.
Start on the obvious double sidepull block. Climb straight up into a fun mantle.
content.location: Slight south east of the intersection. Can be seen from the red trail.

content.description: Absolutely gorgeous, and extremely high quality rock. The movement is interesting. It only misses out on 4 stars because its a dropoff! (unless you want to solo the topout).
content.location: Slight south west of the intersection. Can be seen from either blue or red trail. It is the lower part of a small cliff.

content.description: Starts standing on a large jug and climbs the slopey slab. Very fun!
content.location: To the left of Carnival (looking at the arete) in the broken cliff just off the green trail.

content.description: Start standing on good holds. Reach up to an enormous jug and climb straight up the arete.
content.location: Obvious arete along the broken cliff band intersected by the trail crossings. Can be seen from the green trail.

content.description: Start stand on the right arete of the unknown compression V3. Strange moves to a jug drop off (or a solo topout).
content.location: Visible off of the blue trail. Far end of the broken cliff band.

content.description: This center of this area is where the blue trail intersects the red trail. There is a nice cluster of boulders right at the intersection, and a small cliff with lots of potential. There are also boulders scattered south west and south east of the intersection.
